cip.render.raytrace

Class RenderXml

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.RenderXml
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRenderScene

    public class RenderXml
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRenderScene
    This is a ray tracer that loads the scene to be rendered from an XML scene description file, and renders that scene using a single sample per pixel. The XML scene description file is loaded by FrameLoader. Refer to the FrameLoader documentation for XML scene description file format and conventions. The entire scene description is dynamically loaded (i.e. this renderer has no knowledge of implemented geometries, lights, materials, textures, etc. comprising an environment. It only knows about interfaces, so, anything that implements the rendering interfaces and is in the classpath can be loaded and rendered). Dynamic loading makes it easy to add new geometry, lights, materials, textures, backgrounds , and illumination models simply by making sure the classpath includes the location of the implementation of the new element, and asking to load it in the XML file.

    Usage: 

         RenderWindow -r cip.render.raytrace.RenderXml -d <sceneDescFile>
    where:
    -d Specify the scene description file, sceneDescFile, that should be loaded for rendering. This string is the name of an XML scene description file that can be parsed by FrameLoader. NOTE: a scene description file is required.
    Note:

    This implementation anticipates implementations with oversampling and jitter (future topics in the course); so, the dispatchPixel and setSampleColor methods of Assignment4 have been renamed dispatchSample and setSample. Additionally, they carry a couple arguments that are unused for a single sample per pixel. This lets us use inheritance through extensions of this renderer that include oversampling and distributed ray tracing.

    Since:
    fall 2002
    See Also:
    FrameLoader, RenderWindow

      • loadScene

        public void loadScene(java.lang.String strSceneDesc)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IRenderScene
        Load a scene from the specified scene description file. The scene description is an XML file that describes the camera, materials, objects, and lighting for a scene along with specifics about rendering the scene.
        Specified by:
        loadScene in interface IRenderScene
        Parameters:
        strSceneDesc - The scene description file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - The exception that may be thrown is specific to the loader. If an exception is thrown the caller is expected to try an create a meaningful message for the user, and then to exit.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Description copied from interface: IRenderScene
        Get the title that should be used for the displayed rendering window. This method will be called after the IRenderScene.loadScene(String) method is called. This allows the title to be part of the loaded scene description.
        Specified by:
        getTitle in interface IRenderScene
        Returns:
        (nullable) The title for the displayed rendering window.

      • renderImage

        public void renderImage(java.awt.Image image)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderScene
        Renders the scene, or a part of the scene, to the an Image.
        Specified by:
        renderImage in interface IRenderScene
        Parameters:
        image - The Image the scene should be rendered to.

      • renderScene

        public void renderScene(java.awt.Component component,
                        java.awt.Graphics gc)
        Description copied from interface: IRenderScene
        Renders the scene, or a part of the scene, to the Graphics context of a window. The component provides the pixel width and height of the drawing surface. The clipBounds of the graphics context describe what part of the component needs to be redrawn. If the component is re-sized, the clipBounds will be the component canvas. If the exposure of the window changes, the clipBounds may only be a small part of the entire component.
        Specified by:
        renderScene in interface IRenderScene
        Parameters:
        component - The component the scene is being rendered into.
        gc - The Graphics context of the component the scene should be rendered to.

      • dispatchPixel

        boolean dispatchPixel(RenderXml.RenderPixel renderThread)
        Dispatch an un-rendered pixel in the image whenever this method is called.
        Parameters:
        renderThread - (RenderPixel, modified) The pixel rendering thread to be loaded with a new pixel to render.
        Returns:
        true if a new pixel was dispatched, false if all pixels have been dispatch and there are no un-rendered pixels left in the image.

      • setSampleColor

        void setSampleColor(int nX,
                    int nY,
                    java.awt.Color clr)
        Set the color for a pixel in the image.
        Parameters:
        nX - (int) The X location of the pixel in the image.
        nY - (int) The Y location of the pixel in the image.
        clr - (Color, readonly) The color of the pixel.
